title: Twitter, IAC, Nvidia, Levi Strauss: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Twitter shares climb on deal report; Megacap tech stocks gain premarket
text:
* Barry Diller's media conglomerate IAC/InteractiveCorp. climbed 4.3% after it reached a $2.7 billion deal to buy Meredith, a magazine publisher with brands such as People and InStyle. Meredith shares added 6.5%.

* Megacap tech companies gained premarket as government bond yields edged down. Apple, Amazon.com, Google-parent Alphabet and Microsoft all added around 1%. Nvidia rose 2% and Square was up 3%.

* Earnings are due from Conagra Brands, Tilray, Lamb Weston and Helen of Troy before the opening bell.

* Levi Strauss advanced 4.6%. The denim company reported higher sales in the third quarter, lifting profits.

* Moderna rose 1.3%. It put forward plans to build a vaccine-manufacturing plant in Africa. At Wednesday's close, the stock had lost over 20% of its value this month so far.

* Oil company shares followed crude prices down. Valero Energy slipped 1.5%, Occidental Petroleum declined 1.2% and Diamondback Energy retreated 1%.

* Accolade will report earnings after the close.

Chart of the Day

* Airline stocks have gained more than 10% over the past month, as broader equity markets tumbled. However, this is merely a partial rebound from a bad summer for aviation shares, including those of plane makers. Only budget-airline stocks currently trade above their pre-Covid levels.

Write to Anna Hirtenstein at anna.hirtenstein@wsj.com

Twitter, IAC, Nvidia, Levi Strauss: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
